intro: Neisosperma brevitubum, commonly known as the short-tubed spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it often thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
